VLIB_recursiveFilterHoriz1stOrderS16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_recursiveFilterHoriz1stOrderS16 (int16_t *out, const int16_t *in, const int32_t width, const int32_t height, const int16_t weight, const int16_t *boundaryLeft, const int16_t *boundaryRight, int16_t *scratch)
int32_t VLIB_recursiveFilterVert1stOrderS16 (int16_t *out, const int16_t *in, const int32_t width, const int32_t height, const int16_t weight, const int16_t *boundaryTop, const int16_t *boundaryBottom, int16_t *scratch)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_recursiveFilterHoriz1stOrderS16 ( int16_t *  out,
const int16_t *  in,
const int32_t  width,
const int32_t  height,
const int16_t  weight,
const int16_t *  boundaryLeft,
const int16_t *  boundaryRight,
int16_t *  scratch 
)

Description
This function implements the 1st order horizontal IIR filter on a 16-bit input array.
Parameters:
[out] *out Filter output image (SQ15.0)
[in] *in Input luma image (SQ15.0)
[in] width Input Width (SQ31.0)
[in] height Image height (SQ31.0)
[in] weight Filter coefficient (SQ15.0)
[in] *boundaryLeft Array of left-boundary values (SQ15.0)
[in] *boundaryRight Array of right-boundary values (SQ15.0)
[in] *scratch Scratch buffer (SQ15.0)
Assumptions
  • The scratch buffer must be at least 8 x width ( 8*width*2 bytes ).
  • The image width and height needs to be a multiple of 4.
  • The input and output image buffers need to be double-word aligned.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.

int32_t VLIB_recursiveFilterVert1stOrderS16 ( int16_t *  out,
const int16_t *  in,
const int32_t  width,
const int32_t  height,
const int16_t  weight,
const int16_t *  boundaryTop,
const int16_t *  boundaryBottom,
int16_t *  scratch 
)

Description
This function implements the 1st order vertical IIR filter on a 16-bit input array.
Parameters:
[out] *out Filter output image (SQ15.0)
[in] *in Input luma image (SQ15.0)
[in] width Input Width (SQ31.0)
[in] height Image height (SQ31.0)
[in] weight Filter coefficient (SQ15.0)
[in] *boundaryTop Array of top-boundary values (SQ15.0)
[in] *boundaryBottom Array of bottom-boundary values (SQ15.0)
[in] *scratch Scratch buffer (SQ15.0)
Assumptions
  • The scratch buffer must be at least 8 x height (8*height*2 bytes).
  • The image width and height needs to be a multiple of 4.
  • The input and output image buffers need to be double-word aligned.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
